predictions.text: U.S. CPI (headline, YoY, NSA) for November 2025 will print between 3.0% and 3.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if BLS CPI-U 12-month percent change (All items) for November 2025 in the official BLS release and series CUUR0000SA0 is >=3.0% and <=3.4%.
evidence: Energy prices were soft in November; gasoline down w/w.
Core services disinflation trend continues in recent prints.
Cleveland Fed nowcast points to subdued MoM, keeping YoY near low-3s.
Consensus surveys cluster around low-3% YoY.
monitoring_signals: BLS CPI release page and data tables
predictions.rationale: Energy softness and moderate core keep YoY near low-3%.

predictions.text: U.S. Core CPI (YoY, NSA) for November 2025 will print between 3.4% and 3.8%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if BLS CPI-U 12-month percent change for Core CPI (All items less food and energy; series CUSR0000SA0L1E) for November 2025 is within 3.4%-3.8%.
evidence: Shelter inflation easing but still elevated keeps core in mid-3s.
Goods deflation persists; services steady.
Recent monthly core prints around 0.2-0.3% imply gradual YoY drift lower.
monitoring_signals: Apartment rent indexes and shelter trackers
predictions.rationale: Shelter stickiness caps disinflation; core drifts mid-3%.

predictions.text: At the December 2025 FOMC meeting, the SEP median projection for the 2025 federal funds rate (year-end) will be between 4.0% and 4.6%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the Summary of Economic Projections shows the median 'appropriate policy' federal funds rate for 2025 (end-of-year) within 4.0%-4.6%, as published on federalreserve.gov.
evidence: Market-implied path signals multiple 2025 cuts but not below ~4%.
Inflation progress is real but incomplete; growth moderate.
Fed speakers cautious about pace of easing.
predictions.rationale: Balanced easing path; dots likely imply several 2025 cuts.

predictions.text: Cboe VIX will close at or below 12.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the official Cboe closing value of VIX is <=12.0 on any trading day through 2025-12-31, per cboe.com historical data.
evidence: Year-end seasonality often compresses implied volatility.
Improved inflation trend and policy visibility damp risk premia.
Strong equity breadth can suppress vol.
predictions.rationale: Seasonal vol compression could briefly push VIX to 12.

predictions.text: Russell 2000 Index (RUT) will close at or above 2,350 on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the official closing level of the Russell 2000 (RUT) on any trading day through 2025-12-31 is >=2,350, per FTSE Russell or major data vendors.
evidence: Falling yields typically aid small-cap multiples and financing.
Potential year-end risk-on rotation into laggards.
Improving soft data (sentiment) supports cyclicals.
monitoring_signals: IWM flows and breadth thrust indicators
predictions.rationale: Rates relief and rotation can lift small caps into year-end.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report will show a Lower 48 net withdrawal of at least 120 Bcf in at least one report published by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if any EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report released by 2025-12-31 reports a Lower 48 net change <= -120 Bcf (i.e., withdrawal of 120 Bcf or more).
evidence: Seasonal December cold snaps can trigger >120 Bcf draws.
Storage is ample but early-winter HDDs can drive large pulls.
Futures/weather models suggest volatility in December demand.
monitoring_signals: EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage reports
predictions.rationale: A stronger threshold refines earlier storage-draw call.

predictions.text: NFIB Small Business 'Plans to Make Capital Outlays' index for November 2025 will print between 20 and 24.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the NFIB Small Business Economic Trends report for November 2025 shows the seasonally adjusted 'Plans to Make Capital Outlays' percentage in the 20–24 range.
evidence: Rates have eased but credit remains tight for small firms.
Headline NFIB optimism improving from lows but still subdued.
Capex plans historically track rates and demand expectations.
monitoring_signals: Senior Loan Officer Opinion Survey signals
predictions.rationale: Improving sentiment, but tight credit caps capex plans.

predictions.text: University of Michigan Index of Current Economic Conditions (preliminary) for December 2025 will print between 67.0 and 74.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the preliminary December 2025 UMich release shows the Index of Current Economic Conditions within 67.0–74.0.
evidence: Gasoline prices stabilized; equity market strength lifts assessments.
Labor market cooling modestly but still resilient.
Recent improvements in sentiment subindices.
predictions.rationale: Stable gas and equities support current-conditions sentiment.

predictions.text: Philadelphia Fed Manufacturing Survey Prices Paid Index for December 2025 will print between 12.0 and 30.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the Philly Fed’s December 2025 Business Outlook Survey shows the Prices Paid diffusion index value within 12.0–30.0.
evidence: National ISM prices indicators remain moderate.
Input costs eased with softer commodities and freight.
Regional surveys show stabilization without sharp reacceleration.
predictions.rationale: Moderate upstream price pressure fits a mid-range print.

predictions.text: NAHB/Wells Fargo Housing Market Index (headline, SA) for December 2025 will print between 34 and 43.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if NAHB’s December 2025 headline HMI (seasonally adjusted) is within 34–43 as published by NAHB.
evidence: Mortgage rates recently fell, aiding sentiment off lows.
Affordability remains constrained; builders still using incentives.
Traffic and sales expectations improving but below neutral (50).
predictions.rationale: Lower rates help, but affordability keeps HMI sub-50.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce at least one Venezuela-related sanctions designation via a U.S. Treasury press release by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if treasury.gov posts a press release announcing sanctions that add at least one Venezuela-related party to the SDN List by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
evidence: U.S. pressure fluctuates with Venezuela compliance and elections.
Periodic tightening around oil sector and individuals persists.
Year-end sanctions actions are common across programs.
monitoring_signals: State Dept./White House statements on Venezuela
predictions.rationale: Policy drift and periodic enforcement make a year-end action plausible.

predictions.text: Google will publish a Chrome Stable Channel update in December 2025 acknowledging at least one High-severity 'use after free' vulnerability in V8.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the Chrome Releases blog or release notes for any Stable update in Dec 2025 list a CVE described as 'Use after free in V8' with severity High or higher.
evidence: UAF in V8 is a frequent class in Chrome advisories.
Monthly Stable updates commonly include V8 fixes.
December typically sees at least one Stable refresh.
predictions.rationale: Historic vulnerability patterns favor at least one V8 UAF fix.

predictions.text: Android’s December 2025 Security Bulletin will include at least one kernel elevation-of-privilege CVE with CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥ 7.8.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the official December 2025 Android Security Bulletin lists any kernel component CVE marked as elevation-of-privilege with CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥7.8.
evidence: Kernel EoP issues are routine in Android bulletins.
Vendors frequently score kernel EoPs ≥7.8 due to impact.
December bulletins historically sizeable across components.
predictions.rationale: Kernel EoPs are common and typically high-severity in bulletins.
